jparsec.math

Class Integration

  • java.lang.Object
    • jparsec.math.Integration
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Integration
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Provides method to perform numerical integration.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    T. Alonso Albi - OAN (Spain)
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • Integration

        public Integration(double[] x,
           double[] y,
           double x1,
           double x2)
            throws JPARSECException
        Default constructor for a given set of x, y values and integration range. Points are sorted in crescent order and repeated points eliminated.
        Parameters:
        x - X values. Should be non null.
        y - Y values. Should be non null.
        x1 - Lower limit of the integration range.
        x2 - Upper limit of the integration range.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

    • Method Detail

      • simpleIntegration

        public double simpleIntegration(double step)
                         throws JPARSECException
        Simple low accuracy numerical integration method, based on the midpoint rule.
        Parameters:
        step - Step in the bisection between two consecutive points in x. Recommended values are around (x2-x1)/1.0E5.
        Returns:
        Integral.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If something goes wrong.

      • simpleIntegrationUsingSpline

        public double simpleIntegrationUsingSpline(double step)
                                    throws JPARSECException
        Simple low accuracy numerical integration method, based on the midpoint rule, using spline interpolation. This is usually a little bit better when having few points.
        Parameters:
        step - Step in the bisection between two consecutive points in x. Recommended values are around (x2-x1)/1.0E5.
        Returns:
        Integral.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If something goes wrong.

      • simpleIntegrationForSortedX

        public static double simpleIntegrationForSortedX(double[] x,
                                 double[] y,
                                 double x1,
                                 double x2,
                                 double step)
                                          throws JPARSECException
        Simple low accuracy numerical integration method, based on the midpoint rule, for x values already sorted in crescent order. This is faster than using an instance of this class, since the constructor checks the ordering. The interpolation used is linear.
        Parameters:
        x - X values, sorted in crescent order.
        y - Corresponding Y values.
        x1 - Lower limit of the integration range.
        x2 - Upper limit of the integration range.
        step - Step in the bisection between two consecutive points in x. Recommended values are around (x2-x1)/1.0E5.
        Returns:
        Integral.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If something goes wrong.

      • getChart

        public CreateChart getChart()
                     throws JPARSECException
        Returns a chart showing the input data and the integrated region.
        Returns:
        The chart.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        For unit testing only.
        Parameters:
        args - Not used.
